results.title: Survival of the fittest
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Small Business”
Why small businesses grow or die - an investigation based on interviews with the principals of a number of firms, ranging from a one-man factory that is doing well to a dynamic enterprise. Gives examples of the special problems of those who inherit a family firm. Small firms are especially vulnerable but sometimes compensate with special satisfactions.

results.title: Survival of the fittest
results.creator_credit: Tessa Laing and St Mary's Anglican Girls' College
results.brief_description: ‘Survival of the Fittest’ constructs the core message that human genetics should not be altered, despite good intentions. Based on a scientific theory by Herbert Spencer that relates to how organisms evolve over time to develop desirable traits. The film explores how scientists can artificially replicate a natural process, which can lead to a negative outcome.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tessa Laing and St Mary’s Anglican Girls’ College

results.title: Survival of the fastest
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Page, Dick Gilling and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Highlights the evolution of the motorcycle from a primitive machine into a gleaming, glamorous, sophisticated piece of engineering. Scenes at Mallory Park and the 1979 Isle of Man TT follow the fortunes of Barry Sheene, Mike Hailwood and Ron Haslam and their machines. Goes into the research and development, technical and commercial problems, and how Britain and Europe are facing up to the Japanese challenge. Narrated by Tony Britton.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cynthia Page, Dick Gilling and British Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: Survival of spaceship earth
results.creator_credit: United Productions of America and Dirk Summers
results.brief_description: Fosters an understanding of the effects technological development and human population have had on the earth’s ecology. Features Hugh Downs, Margaret Mead, John D. Rockefeller III, Lady Barbara Ward Jackson, Harrison Brown, and Walter Orr Roberts. Narrated by Raymond Burr.

results.title: Survival in the hills
results.creator_credit: Explorer Films, Peter Halket, Maurice Dybeck and Christopher Were
results.brief_description: Aimed at anyone who is responsible in any way for mountain safety, whether as a leader or merely for themselves. Covers topics including: things that can go wrong; all aspects relating to exposure; suitable food and drinks; how to get help map and compass work; detours; accidents and simple first aid; and a summary of helpful general rules

results.title: Survival
results.creator_credit: Eric L. Morris, Frank Killian and Movietone Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Review: 26th year”
Shows many birds and animals of Australia and their methods of survival, and contrasts them with man and his recklessness on the roads.

results.title: Survival
results.creator_credit: Robert Kruger and National Coal Board
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Mining Review: 26th year”
Space age technology has turned its hand to the saving of lives at sea. A revolutionary capsule, taking the place of the conventional lifeboat, goes through its paces rescuing men from a North Sea rig.
